newsitem.title: USA: U.S. stocks seen higher at opening.
newsitem.headline: U.S. stocks seen higher at opening.

text.p: Wall Street stocks are expected to move higher at the open on Tuesday after registering their first rise in nearly a week on Monday.
The market will remain volatile, however, and the opening will give little clue as to the close, analysts said.
They expected continued turbulence in a week larded with important economic data and the second part of Federal Reserve chairman Alan Greenspan's Humphrey-Hawkins testimony.
Monday's upward move was due to buying in index funds which pushed blue chips higher. The Dow Jones Industrial average closed up 41.18 points at 6,918.92 on Monday.
